intro: Pectocarya platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited pectocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central and southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, triangular leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, greenish-white inflorescences, and the fruit is a small, fleshy capsule. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
